content.description: This is an extension of the roof climb, Into the Fire. Left of the roof, start low on the small arete with hands on the shelf and a heel around the arete. Move up to a stand on decent crimps then traverse right and climb Into the Fire. This line extends the pump factor while addingÂ  movement and a more defined start to an already fun climb.
content.protection: The landing is decent, but having multiple pads helps a lot for the traversing nature of the route. Be wary of the spiky rock behind the roof
content.location: Look for the obvious roof feature. This extension starts on the arete a few feet left of the roof. Avoid using the low sloping shelf on during the traverse

content.description: This is a detached block roof feature that looks intimidating but climbs great. You'll encounter a juggy arete for one hand, great underclings for the other, and a sloping platform for feet to keep the tension. Stick in a kneebar or heel hook, reach the hold on the face, finish the easy top out, and smile! There are still good problems to be found at the lake :-)
content.protection: Multiple pads. Be wary of the spiky rock a few feet back below the roof
content.location: Left hand starts on the shelf just left of the roof. Right hand starts on the lower arete. Avoid using the sloped shelf down low for feet

content.description:
Start sitting on the angled boulder, facing the corner with hands matched low in the crack. Step onto decent feet and make a big move to good holds on the horizontal. Switch your stance and use the arete to top out. 

 This is a detached block and although solid, one day it will fall. Pulling on it during the topout creates an uneasiness that either adds or takes away from the climb, depending on your outlook that day
content.location: Just right of the inside corner, next to A Little Choss

content.description: From a sit follow the sandstone jugs up the face. Stay off the quartzite to the left and top out
content.location: In the left corner of the alcove. Its the only sandstone around so easy to spot

content.description: Start matched on the low shelf and move up to the angled shelf. Continue up and left on jugs to top out the boulder.
content.location: On the same chockstone as A Little Moss, this climb uses the quartzite portion of the boulder to go up. Just left of the inside corner

content.description: A small alcove of low cliffs just across the road from the fire road boulder. This area is mostly chossy detached blocks, but the corner of the alcove has fun lines
